page.title: 18FAMOUS INHABITANTS
page.content: The Dependents There is a brown gate down on the west side of London Road near the Antique Shop in Northchapel which leads to a chapel with a brown door. That chapel belongs to the small religious group called the Dependents. There are only eight people in this group and they have a nickname of the 'Cokelers' because they always offer their guests a cup of cocoa. There was once hundreds of Cokelers but they became fewer over the years because members were asked not to marry or have children.They believed that large families bred poverty.They also disliked alcohol and served cocoa to entice outsiders to their meetings. The Dependents give sorrow at birth and rejoice in death. They were,and still are,a much respected sect in the village.
